<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:17] Really quickly, 3 simple things that I did not mention earlier
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:19] First:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:25] The dowhile loop
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:29] do {
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:33]     stuff
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:41] } while (conditions);
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:06:55] It is very much like a while loop,
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:08] except the condition is checked after the body has been run
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:17] So the body will always execute at least once
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:34] Useful for when you have something like:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:37] dostuff
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:43] while (condition) {
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:49]     dotheexactsamestuff
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:07:51] }
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:01] Next
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:05] The switch statement
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:16] switch (variable) {
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:24]     case somevalue:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:28]         dostuff
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:34]         break;
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:36] }
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:41] Okay
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:08:54] The switch statement checks if the variable is equal to a bunch of stuff,
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:14] The break meaning it exits the switch and doesn't check for anything else
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:29] You can also have stuff like:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:35] switch (variable) {
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:44]     case value:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:48]     case othervalue:
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:53]         dostuff
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:57]         break;
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:09:59] }
<seidos>	[Jun 21 20:10:08] do you have to put break;?
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:10:15] In which "dostuff" will execute if variable is value or othervalue
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:10:48] seidos, It makes sense to usually, since your variable probably isn't going to be two values at once.
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:11:04] However, you could have a case that changes the variable for a further case.
<seidos>	[Jun 21 20:11:12] why do you put break; in the second case but in the 1st case?
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:11:16] seidos, So, technically not, but usually you will.
<bgs100>	[Jun 21 20:11:22] seidos, Because,
<seidos>	[Jun 21 20:11:30] s/but/but not
